page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {The area covered by this survey is 400 kilometres above sea level.The land is largely covered by rough grazing,so sheep are a major factor of the area .The attractive bleakness of the landscape is broken up by the Forestry Commision. The area is rich in minerals as it used to be the centre of lead mining.The quarrying is still carried out here .There are three villages in the area Bwlchgwyn,Gwynfrynand the largest Minera.None of these have many services and they have to depend on Coedpoeth,the adjoining village,or on Wrexham,6 miles away.Public transport is acceptable during the day,but a car is essential in this rural district
